intro: Mikania jelskii, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, funnel-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other climbing plants. Mikania jelskii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
